text: Merrilliobryum fabronioides is a species of mosses in the family Myriniaceae. It is endemic to the Philippines, where it is known from a few locations in the mountains of northern Luzon. It is an endangered species found in habitat that is degraded by agriculture, logging, and mining. ==References== Category:Hypnales Category:Endemic flora of the Philippines Category:Endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Merrilliobryum fabronioides
